Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Natrone Anthony was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Natrone Anthony was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Natrone Anthony is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Stalking - Result in Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Battery to Injunction Petitioner [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1m)(a).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Possession of Electric Weapon, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.295(1m).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Natrone Anthony was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Natrone Anthony in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Natrone Anthony in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 14:  On Court's own motion, the Domestic Abuse Surcharge enhancer is struck.  

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made by Theresa A., Crystal C., Tranae A., Natrone A. Jr. and Journey C.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 189 days served.  Court ordered 5 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 5 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Count 1; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 1 YEAR Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 13:   Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 1 YEAR Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 14:   Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 1 YEAR Extended Supervision.
.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim during the entire sentence unless approved by Court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- AS TO COUNT 1:  Pay a fine of $1000.00 inclusive of all costs, fees and surcharges.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Due to financial hardship, Court waived ALL other costs, fees and surcharges pertaining to Counts 2,3,4,5,6,7,8,13,14,17.

AS TO COUNT 3:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 0 days time served. 
.
AS TO COUNT 4:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 0 days time served. 
.
AS TO COUNT 5:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 0 days time served. 
.
AS TO COUNT 6:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 0 days time served. 
.
AS TO COUNT 7:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 0 days time served. 
.
AS TO COUNT 8:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 0 days time served. 
.
AS TO COUNT 16:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 0 days time served. 
.
AS TO COUNT 17:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 0 days time served.

Defendant Natrone Anthony in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Natrone Anthony in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On the same day, at the hour of 2:25 pm the jury returned and by the foreperson brought in verdicts of GUILTY as To Counts 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,13,14,16, and 17, and NOT GUILTY as to Counts 9,10,11,12,15,18,19, and 20 which were read in open court.  The Court polled the Jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdicts.  Jury verdicst received and filed.  Jury discharged.
The Court denied the defense motion for judgments notwithstanding the verdicts as to Counts 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,13,14,16, and 17 and granted the motion for judgments of acquittal as to Counts 9,10,11,12,15,18,19, and 20.
The Court granted the State's motion for judgment on the verdicts as to  Counts 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,13,14,16, and 17 and ordered that judgments of conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  At request of the parties, Court ordered PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Natrone Anthony in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Natrone Anthony in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury in box at 9:34.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate jurors selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:25 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies S. Urbaniak and M. Tinsley who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Natrone Anthony in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Natrone Anthony in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Instructions reviewed by the parties.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Jury excused for the evening at 4:50 pm.  Sidebars put on the record.  Jury trial contined to 8/20/15 at 9:00 am.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Natrone Anthony not in court, in custody.  Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Additional discovery turned over. Case remains set for Final Pretrial on 8/4/2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 8/17/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 40. Case adjourned to branch 40.

Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed. This is a rotation substitution. Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court, effective 8/1/2015, this case is reassigned pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 40. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 40. Case further set for a Status Conference in branch 23. Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Natrone Anthony in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Natrone Anthony in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Joseph Goggins. Received into evidence exhibit #1. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #15FA1950, and proof of service attached to complaint. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Discussion regarding Information filed by the court, state amended information to change counts 3-8 to reflect counts 21-26. Court held initial appearance as to new Counts 21-26 and found probable cause. Defendant advised of maximum penalties. Original information with corrected count numbers received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Bail from 15CM1235 & 15CM1495 which were dismissed are ordered transfered to this case.  Exhibit List Filed.

Attorney Thomey in court, defendant Natrone Anthony not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. At request of the state and stipulation of the defense, court GRANTED adjournment of Preliminary Hearing to branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
